name: Hello Kitty forum secrets
description: Somebody found and send you the database of a very popular HelloKitty forum. Apparently the forum uses old technology to save passwords, so it should be easy to crack with some password power. Maybe the HelloKitty passwords also work in Amazon to order some HelloKitty merch...

name: Crack'n'Hack
description: %CONTACT% from %COMPANY% called us today. They accidentally deleted their %PW_APPLICATION% passwords and need some cracking power.

name: Security awareness lecture
description: Prof. %CONTACT%, head of %TOWN% %UNIVERSITY% asked you to give a lecture on security awareness.
onSuccess: It was great. Your demonstration of an attack on a %WEBSERVICE% really kicked ass.
onFail: The lecture was a complete disaster. Prof. %CONTACT% will probably not invite you again.

name: IT security lecture
description: Mister %CONTACT%, CEO at %COMPANY% in %TOWN% wants you to give a lecture on IT security in cooperation with the %TOWN% %UNIVERSITY%.

name: No, this is Patrick
description: The %TOWN% %UNIVERSITY% develops a new %SOFTWARE% and needs your help for implementing a new security scheme.

name: Homefront
description: The guy next door, %CONTACT_M%, has a barking dog that really upsets you. Hack his %PW_APPLICATION% as payback.

name: C'mon Honey
description: The %TOWN% library frequently gets hacked by some bad guys. Install a honeypot in their IT system to catch those script kiddies.

name: You, Robot
description: %COMPANY%, a smart home equipment manufacturer has been hijacked. All it's products are now part of a botnet. You need to wipe the malware and find the companies security leak.

name: Memeful intermezzo
description: The monitoring screens at %COMPANY% suddenly started to display some dank memes. CEO %CONTACT% turns to you in desperate need of help.
onSuccess: You did it! They were using Win XP and an old Flash version vulnerable to man in the middle attacks. Of course you saved the dankest memes for your private collection.

name: Dayly bread
description: You are hired for holding a security audit at a %COMPANY% facility in %TOWN%. Hack into their %PW_APPLICATION% to raise security awareness.

name: Catch a ride
description: The %COMPANY% motor company is evaluating the security of their cars electronic key system. Intercept the keys radio signal and copy it onto a duplicate key. How about a new BMW?

name: You have no power here
description: The %TOWN% power plant organizes a competition for hackers to find security vulnerabilities in their IT system. All piece of cake since they are still running on XP.

name: %TOWN% tech festival
description: You have the opportunity to present your company at the %TOWN% tech festival. Gather together some cool gadgets and choreograph them with custom software.

name: Censorship is [CENSORED]
description: %COMPANY% and the %TOWN% %UNIVERSITY% are cooperating to develop an open-source anti censorship software. Help improving their protocol with some extra manpower.

name: Rainbow shield
description: %COMPANY% hosts a %WEBSERVICE% that has been jammed by frequent DDOS attacks. You need to identify the origin of the threat and implement a robust counter mechanism.

name: Fixing potholes
description: %COMPANY% has problems integrating a new %SOFTWARE% into their %WEBSERVICE%.
onSuccess: Easy Peasy. This %SOFTWARE% is absolutely amazing.
onFail: This %SOFTWARE% and their %WEBSERVICE% must be written in gibberish++. After days of nonsense you give up.

name: Golden Age of Piracy
description: The %TOWN% %UNIVERSITY% spin-of %COMPANY% launches an innovative %SOFTWARE%. You are asked to audit their piracy protection system.
onSuccess: Wow, this tech is amazing! Now those pirates are gonna have a hard time.
onFail: Somehow you missed that obvious vulnerability. The %SOFTWARE% was cracked hours after release.
